statement.tex: \text{The amount of pollution content added in}\\ \text{air in a city due to x-diesel vehicles is given} \\ \text{by }P(x) = 0.005x^3 + 0.02 x^2 + 30 x.\text{ Find the}\\ \text{marginal increase in pollution content when}\\ \text{3 diesel vehicles are added and write which }\\ \text{value is indicated in the above question.}

step.context: \text{How many vehicles are on the road when}\\ \text{this marginal increase is to be calculated?}
step.reason: \textbf{Don't over think! It is a 1-mark problem.}\\ \text{If you thought that there are x vehicles}\\ \text{now and }x+3\text{ vehicles later, then you}\\ \text{are over thinking it.} \\ \text{Yes, it is a badly worded problem. But the}\\ \text{implicit assumption is that there were no }\\ \text{vehicles before and now there are three.}

step.context: \textbf{Marginal increase and total pollution.}\\ \text{Given }P(x),\text{ what will be the marginal increase}\\ \text{in pollution when there are already 3 vehicles on}\\ \text{the road? How much is the total pollution then?}
step.reason: \text{The marginal increase in pollution when }\\ x=3\text{ is simply,}\\ \begin{align} \left[\dfrac{d}{dx}P(x)\right]_{x=3} &= \left[\underbrace{0.15x^2 + 0.04x^2 + 30}_{\frac{d}{dx}P(x)}\right]_{x=3} \\ &= 31.47 \end{align} \\ \text{The total pollution content is simply }\\ P(3) = 0.005\cdot 3^3 + 0.02\cdot 3^2 + 30\cdot 3 = 90.315.
